intro: Strobilanthes walkeri var. macrosperma, commonly known as the giant strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces large, vibrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
